"We have real challenges in terms of unemployment," Kirsten Gillibrand told the round-table discussion, adding that unemployment rates of 15 percent among recently discharged veterans "can not be tolerated." We need to do better in terms of making opportunities available to these veterans so they can get good paying jobs, she added. "A lot of veterans don't even know what programs they're eligible for." But he asked that this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people. UNTIL JAN 23, 3:00 p.m. BERKELEY- Treasurer Bill Lockyer said Saturday that if lawmakers fail to quickly adopt significant budget cuts, the state could be forced to begin issuing IOUs beginning in May. Depending on whether cuts are made soon, we may have to have IOUs go out in May, he said during a luncheon speech at a political seminar. Controller John Chiang, who would be responsible for making such a decision, has not publicly warned of that possibility. "I'm not supposed

back and reconsider how the devastating decision to cancel BSF projects in Waltham Forest was made. It is a victory for common sense and fair play." A spokesman for the Department for Education said: We are delighted that the judge did not call into question the decision to end the wasteful and bureaucratic Building Schools for the Future programme. On the substantive points he concluded that it was a rational decision and that the authorities involved had no expectation of being allowed to proceed with their projects. Mr Michael Gove will now look again at his decision with regard to these authorities with an open mind, taking representations from them, the spokesman added. Keep up to date with the news.

He said Wall Street was comfortable with Eric Schmidt , and that investors may question whether Page is the right person for the job because he lacks CEO experience at a major public company. Certainly, there will be some concerns going forward, Moran said. "He will have to prove himself."
